title: Senior Full-Stack Software Development Engineer
description: Currently it takes the same amount of time to process an average American mortgage as it does to walk nonstop from Manhattan to San Francisco. Talk about getting your steps in. This is the kind of technology ‚Äì or lack thereof ‚Äì that the mortgage industry is dealing with daily. Papercuts are a real concern. We have even heard rumors of fax machines and whiteout. Still no actual dinosaur sightings, but we are ever vigilant.pReady to roll up your sleeves and help us conquer the last frontier of fintech?  At Xpanse, we are working to disrupt an $11 trillion industry. Yep, you read that right - $11 trillion with a ‚Äút‚Äù. If the US mortgage industry was its own sovereign nation, it would be the third largest in the world by GDP.pSuffice to say, we are building to scale. What are we building?pOur SaaS platform will power the mortgage industry and its relationships with the tens of thousands of third-party providers that are integral to the mortgage process. Leveraging automation, real-time intelligence, big data, and analytics we are changing the way borrowers, lenders, servicers, and service providers take care of business.pBut disrupting an industry is a team sport, so we are looking for the best and brightest to join us. Our team is growing rapidly in the Greater Seattle Area and looking for cstrongSenior Full-Stack Software Development Engineersstrong to join our team.pcstrongWHAT YOU WILL BE DOINGstrongpculcliProviding technical leadership to help the team solve difficult technical problemslicliEstablishing and enforcing high standards in software engineering best practiceslicliHelping teammates become better software engineerslicliFormulating development plans and writing lots and lots of codeliulcstrongWHO YOU AREstrongpculcliYou have a team-first mentality, and value collaborative results over personal accoladeslicliYou have an owner‚Äôs instinct and sense of responsibilitylicliYou have an ability to execute challenging gameplans and deliver measurable resultslicliYou've demonstrated an ability to successfully engage productively with leaders and peersliulcstrongBASIC QUALIFICATIONSstrongpculcliAt least 5 years experience in the software industry as a developer delivering enterprise softwarelicliGood working knowledge of service-oriented architectures, cloud-based solutions (e.g. AWS), middle-tier frameworks (e.g. Spring, .Net framework), data streaming/computation microservices (e.g. Kafka, Flink), and relational and/or non-relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL)licliFluent in Java or C#licliA bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fieldliulcstrongPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSstrongpculcliFintech, B2B/B2B2C technology, or start-up company experiencelicliFront-end development experience using modern frameworks like Node.js, React, etc.liulXpanse is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.p

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Full Stack Developerpcommonsku is revolutionizing the way business is being done in the $25 Billion promotional marketing industry. commonsku is an established and rapidly growing SaaS application facilitating how swag is ordered and produced, handling the supply chain complexities of millions of branded products.  Over $900 Million goes through the platform from entrepreneurs all over the world who use commonsku to power their business.pThe opportunity:pWe develop an elegant and complex application that is transforming a multi-billion dollar industry, solving the problems of thousands by streamlining their businesses. From the development of new features to re-architecting our web app to scale, you will work on new functional components, integration with other software systems, as well as underlying architectural elements that enhance this experience. You will also have the flexibility to experiment with new technologies and contribute to the evolution of our master product, as well as contribute to special development projects related to our event business and the social community.pThe big picture:pAs a key member of a growing team developing an industry-leading SaaS application, you will work directly with the CTO and founders of the company.  We work in a highly collaborative, entrepreneurial environment; we are a small team where your opinion matters. You will have a wide range of responsibilities and will get exposure to all aspects of the platform.pThe environment:pOur culture is diverse, friendly, with a laid-back enthusiasm and sense of humour that makes collaboration easy. We‚Äôre passionate about our customers and their success, and we love fostering an environment that ignites creativity and celebrates the entrepreneur.  We work remote seamlessly with a distributed team across Canada and the US, while maintaining a base at HQ in Toronto.pSkills amp; RequirementspSkills:pCreative thinkerExcellent communication skillsTeam playerAbility to rapidly learn new technologiesProduce high-quality elegant designs rapidlyAble to juggle multiple prioritiespQualifications:pExperience in database driven web application design and developmentFull stack developerExperience with PHP, Python, JSExperience with Django or Laravel (similar MVC/MVT framework), Node, Express, ReactExperience with MySQLKnowledge of web protocols and standards (SSL, OAuth2, etc)Experience with software version control systems (GIT)pGood to have experience with:pReact NativeNoSQLcontainerization (Docker)AWSautomation (Chef/Puppet, Ansible, Cloudformation etc.)Serverless (API Gateway, Lambda)p

title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
description: Thanks for your interest in working with us! Defendify is a fast-growing, fun-loving cybersecurity startup with a small, vibrant team based in Portland, Maine. Resourcefulness, responsiveness, problem-solving, and simplicity are values that shape who we are, what we do, and how we deliver amazing customer experiences.pcstrongPosition DetailsstrongpWe're looking for a senior full stack software engineer to join us full-time, locally and/or in a remote capacity. This is a unique and exciting opportunity as we continue to expand the footprint of our groundbreaking, all-in-one cybersecurity platform. Every team member is a valuable contributor to our core SaaS product with day-to-day responsibilities covering a variety of development needs including building, maintaining, QA, and support for every aspect of the Defendify platform.pcstrongWe are looking for a team player who:strongpculcliHas a passion for solving problems and is eager to grow, learn, and tackle daily and long-term challenges and goals.licliWill dig in and ask questions from users to understand requirements; make a plan; dive into an existing codebase and learn where to make changes, or where to start new code.licliIs a good communicator who enjoys collaboration and thrives in a development culture that values clean code, automation and testability.licliMaintains excellent knowledge of how modern web applications work, including REST API usage, application security, cloud deployment and development best practices.licliIs comfortable self-directing their own work. No micro-management here!liulcstrongRequirements ‚Äì Experiencestrongpculcli5+ years of Full-Stack Development experiencelicliHas been responsible for the entire lifecycle of code in at least one project, from scratch to QA to deployment to maintenance.licliHas experience implementing a RESTful API and an application which consumes it.licliIs familiar with the philosophy and implementation of development automation: tests, continuous integration, cloud deployment, and frequent production releases using an Agile/SCRUM process.licliSome DevOps experience is required.liulcstrongRequirements ‚Äì TechnicalstrongpculcliExperienced in JavaScript including ES6, await/async, linting and front-end frameworks. We use libraries and frameworks as needed, but you need to be able to write and understand plain JS.licliExperience with Node and Browser based environments is required.licliUnderstands REST APIs and their role in application architectures. Has used and built APIs from the ground up.licliExperience with front end development: HTML, CSS, and familiarity with the ecosystem of related technologies (SASS, DOM). In addition, Vue (or similar framework) experience and knowledge of static site generators such as Jekyll/Hugo are helpful.licliUnderstand how to use Git(+Hub) and GitHub Flow.licliSome relational database experience is required. Pluses include: Experiences in relational and in-memory databases (MySQL, Postgres, Redis) as well as knowledge in generic SQL.licliSome experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Heroku, or similar services.liulcstrongYour SuccessstrongpYou are not alone in your role ‚Äì Defendify's engineering team is made up of "A" players dedicated to your training and success. We thrive on an open-door policy and transparent management system that fosters team collaboration.pcstrongCompensation and BenefitsstrongpThis is a flexible position open to candidates with varying levels of experience and offers long term growth potential via a well-defined career path. Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience, and is variable based on personal and team performance. Our benefits package is comprehensive and includes health, dental, and vision coverage, educational reimbursement, a 401(k) program, paid time-off and more.pcstrongLove What You DostrongpDefendify employees enjoy a modern work environment and culture where everyone genuinely cares about the work they do. We're passionate about our product, the problems we're solving, our customers, our partners, and our team. We're in it together, enjoying work and play every day from team lunches, impromptu social outings and celebrations, and charity missions. And yes, there is coffee, lots and lots of coffee!pcstrongOpportunity KnocksstrongpThis position offers a great opportunity to make an impact as a part of a small team solving big problems, making cybersecurity possible for Small Business. Are you a creative self-starter with an appetite to learn and grow? If so, we'd love to hear from you!p

title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack
description: We are a remote-first, office-optional team. The pandemic has made this more true than ever. Small businesses face unprecedented challenges in connecting with their audiences, as consumers are also challenged to connect with friends and family. Video can bring us together.pThat‚Äôs why our mission is to help anyone make a powerful, professional video. We make best-in-class, easy-to-use web and mobile video creation apps, with pre-built narrative templates and stunning video styles, that help our customers customize their own engaging videos to share on social media and beyond.pOver the next three years, we have a mission to make video creation faster, easier, and more fun, on any device, in ways that have never been done before.pWe are looking for a senior full stack engineer to join our product application teams. You will be working closely with the product, design mobile and other full-stack engineers to help propel our award-winning video creation service to the next level. You will be developing a responsive, elegant web experience and pioneering the next generation of video creation software.pWhat you‚Äôll do:pculcliCollaborate with a team of engineers and product designers to develop new features while iterating and improving the existing experiencelicliBuild efficient and reusable React components and services using NodeJS and Ruby on RailslicliEnsure high standards in architecture discussions, code reviews, and provide technical leadershiplicliAdvocate for best practices, great usability, and exceptional qualityliulWhat we‚Äôre looking for:pculcli5+ years of professional experience building front-end web applicationslicliExpert knowledge of JavaScriptlicliExperience with modern JavaScript libraries and toolinglicliExperience with server-side web frameworkslicliClient-side performance and optimization experiencelicliStrong Computer Science fundamentalslicliExcellent communication and organization skillsliulWhat we offer:pculcliOpportunities for professional growthlicli100% covered health insurancelicliEquitylicliContribution to 401klicli$600 as part of our subscriptions perklicliRemote work setuplicliBi-weekly Product Demos, Social Thursdays, Focus FridayslicliBi-annual company events and hackathonsliulPlease note that we are not currently sponsoring visas.pWe embrace the differences of our team members and seek diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and all the other things that make us unique. It is our inherent belief that diverse teams build better products. We aim to create a space where employees can bring their true selves to work every day. Animoto is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We welcome you to be a part of it.p

title: Software Engineer
description: Your talent and creative mind are needed at Urbantz !pJoin our team as a Software engineer (Intermediate ‚Äì Senior level).pWhat? Javascript / React / MongoDB / KubernetespWhere? Remote from anywhere in Europe OR at our Brussels officepWhen? ASAPpAbout UspUrbantz operates on one of the most growing markets, offering a SaaS solution for retail, logistics, and e-commerce - businesses that tremendously accelerated in 2020.We‚Äôre growing fast for the last 5 years - recently Deloitte has listed as among the top 3 fastest growing startups in Belgium.We‚Äôre a team of diverse people who make things happen.Our culture is built on experimentation, constant development, flexibility, and encouragement of initiatives in an international, English speaking work environment.Company size: 50-60 people#TogetherWeDeliverpAbout the Teamp‚ÄúThink, try, fail, collaborate and grow a better developer.‚ÄùpAs a company, we believe that, sometimes, failing is the best way to learn and get better at what you do.We believe in the richness of collaboration and of diversity, for everyone to make an impact and work together toward a common goal.We offer a flexible and fun working environment with lots of autonomy and possibility to grow as a professional and as a person. Our unit-tests use Jest, and our end-to-end tests use Protractor. We store data using MongoDB. Our containerization amp; orchestration uses Docker + Kubernetes.We work with short agile development cycles, with an alternance of 3 weeks on specific tasks and 1 week of cool down period to prepare for the next cycle.pAbout YoupYou are positive minded and like to find ways to constantly improve in what you do.pYou can get things done and communicate well while doing it;You are fluent in English;You have at least one relevant experience;You stay abreast of developments and best practices within the technologies we use.You already have affinity with logistic sector or interested to learn about it.What‚Äôs in it for you?pA fast growing company with lots of great challenges.A permanent contract with a great extra-legal package in Belgium, or a nice freelance long term collaboration anywhere in Europe.Flexible company, nice colleagues to work with, fun company activities (even for our remote people!),...If you desire to work to have an impact and bring a change: don‚Äôt hesitate and apply now!pInterview ProcesspBrief phone conversation with HRInterview with 2 team membersTechnical testInterview with CTO/Technical leads(A quick chat with CEO or COO)p#TogetherWeDeliverp

title: Senior JavaScript Fullstack Developer
description: You will be joining a platform focused on building software products and services that are critical to the Research and Development pipeline. These include core systems that track the genes and associated meta data that have the potential to be the next blockbuster biotech trait for insect and weed resistance, increased yield or improved quality.pYou may also be involved in building products that support the Agricultural biologicals business. You will have an opportunity to drive innovation in agriculture via software products that support cutting edge technologies including Next Gen Sequencing and Gene editing.pThis team specifically works on the following products: Sequence Utility Resource (SeqUR) is a sequence repository and data asset housing pipeline constructs, genes, proteins, and collaboration sequences allowing users to store, search, and analyze sequence data that helps fuel Crop Science Ramp;D pipeline.pOur products include real-time streaming analytics from an expanding collection of connected devices, mobile data collection, visualization suites, big data genomics repositories, and geospatial computing systems, just to name a few. To build great software, we need great people.pSkills Required (Bare Minimum): NodeJS, AWS Lambda, Cloudformation Templates, Vue, React, SQL, Postgres, strong communication skills, good teaming and collaboration skills, passion for learning.pJob Description:-Work as part of an agile development team to build and support applications.-Work with team and product manager to manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.-Interact directly with business customers to gather and understand requirements and how they translate in application features.-Develop applications and services using the right tool for the job. -Conduct functional and non-functional testing.-Troubleshoot and debug applications.-Deploy applications across all environments in collaboration with development team, product management, and delivery.-Focus on code quality, including performing unit and integration testing.-Evaluate existing applications to refactor, update and add new features.-Develop any technical documentation needed to accurately represent application design and code.-Help to shape the vision for their own team's products, taking in to account impacts, dependencies, and opportunities to collaborate with other teams and groups.-Identify and pursue opportunities to improve own knowledge and skills.-Identify opportunities to develop new and better solutions.-Implement solutions to technical obstacles affecting own teampLearn amp; Grow:Ongoing focus on growth through training (domain and technical) and knowledge sharing through communities of agile teams.Innovation days, hack-a-thons, networking events, and volunteer opportunities.Diverse technology stacks in a forward thinking, open source-centric environment.pCollaborate:Work with other talented people solving a wide range of complex and unique challenges that have real world impact.Open workspace promotes collaboration and pairing in a fun, casual environment.We value your talent over a role or title. Strength of ideas valued over position on an org chart.pCulture:Work life balance and flexibility is not just discussed, it is our way of life.Challenging how things are done is not just encouraged, it is expected.We value autonomous, self-organizing teams allowing you to have a real say in what you work on, who you work with, and how you work.pOwnership:Interact directly with customers to create critical business solutions. Be responsible for architecting, implementing, testing, deploying, and supporting the software that drives Biotech Company Crop Science.Work with your team and product owner to manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.p

title: AI Specialist / Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d)
description: ch2Company Descriptionh2We're Element 84 and we're taking on some of the biggest challenges in software: petabyte search, consumer streaming, and Earth science repositories, just to name a few. We are a team of gamers, musicians, artists, pitmasters, pilots, and tinkerers and we think you might have fun helping us solve some big problems. Element 84 was founded by husband-and-wife engineers and has grown into a skilled group of developers, designers, project managers, and a business team that builds high performance systems for some of the biggest corporate and government clients in the world. Our main office is located in Alexandria, VA but we support a large remote workforce from Michigan to Texas and Pennsylvania to California.pch2Job Descriptionh2The Element 84 Cloud Based Metrics team develops data pipelines to supply geospatial data archive centers with relevant metrics collection dashboards to aid in their transition to the cloud. The Cloud Based Metrics team is an established and high performing agile team working in the Scaled Agile Framework methodology.pThis requirement is for a software engineer to assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines for a Cloud Based Metrics System, facilitating data through the ingest process to dashboard visualizations, utilizing AWS services and the ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana).pPermission to work in the United States without sponsorship is required; All candidates must be able to pass a National Agency Clearance with Inquires (NACI) screening.pch2Required Skills:h2culcliAbility to effectively scope work from end user‚Äôs data reporting goals.licliAbility to administer Elasticsearch cluster including cluster/shard sizing, reindexing and debug common problems arising from running a self managed multi-tenant cluster.licliAbility to write data pipelines to parse logs using Logstash plugins.licliAbility to create graphs and dashboards in Kibana to meet end user reporting requirements and debug problems with data visualization.licliExperience with AWS services such as Cloudformation, EC2, Kinesis, Lambda, SQS, Cloudwatch and S3.licliExperience with NodeJS.liulch2Desired Skills:h2culcliFamiliarity with log formats from various AWS services such as S3 server access , Cloudfront distribution, Lambda execution, ELB, Container execution etc.licliExperience with Kibana Query Language, Lucene Query Language, and/or QuerydsllicliDesire to become an AWS Certified architect / engineer.licliBachelor's degree in a related field (preferred)liulch2Additional Informationh2Paying attention to who we are -- as a company, as people, as family members, friends, and colleagues, is probably the biggest part of who we are. There are lots of ways to run a company and you have probably experienced more than your share. For us, it's wanting to come to work, being around people we enjoy, taking on big things with people you trust, and sharing our achievements as a team.pculcliYou‚Äôll get credit when things go right and we‚Äôll have your back when things go wrong.licliWe only take on work that is challenging and right for us. There are projects we will turn down and the team has a say.licliWe may be a small company, but we have big company benefits meant to support the idea that we're here for the long term and that happiness comes from much more than just where you work, including 401k, health amp; dental insurance, life amp; disability insurance, flexible schedule, cell phone stipend, flexible spending accounts for transportation and dependent care and a generous PTO policy.liulWe have an extraordinary retention rate because we only hire extraordinary people. We hope that‚Äôs you.pElement 84 is an equal opportunity employer, with a company culture that values diversity. title: DevOps Engineer
description: Love sharing your knowledge, and teaching devs how to deploy their code?Curious about working with different stacks in different domains?Passionate about life and have hobbies you just can‚Äôt shut up about?pSounds like you are a Reaktorian already üòépAt Reaktor, we design and build tomorrow‚Äôs digital products. We are owned by our employees, known for an award-winning culture, and have a Node.js running satellite on low Earth orbit.pThe Amsterdam office has grown from a three-person corner room (and temporary camp) at WeWork to a fifty-person canal house on Looiersgracht (and a boat in the canal). And, we think our story in the Netherlands has only seen its pilot.pReaktor teams work in close co-operation with our clients. We deliver anything from automating beer brewing processes and scaling the streaming of popular TV shows (hint: winter is coming), to refining global scale ecommerce services to withstand 200k+ RPM traffic peaks during Black Friday sales.pYour job is to enable a worry-free development experience for your team. You make sure that automation and monitoring is in place, and that our clients understand the hows and whys of the infrastructure.pch3What we expect from youh3culcliYou hate repetitive work and agree that if it can be documented, it can be automated.licliYou want to work as a part of a development team.licliYou want to apply your knowledge to building scalable, observable systems.licliYou like to make application developers smile every time they use git push.liulch3What we offer, technically speakingh3culcliWe use the best tools for the job at hand. It can mean building a system on top of Kubernetes, or letting Heroku do the heavy lifting.licliWe automate things to the point where we can observe a platform auto-adjust itself during a sudden twentyfold traffic peak.licliOftentimes problems are best solved with no infrastructure or code at all, but with talking to the right people.licliOur juniors and seniors alike work on both the shiny and dirty bits of the infrastructure. No ivory tower architects here.licliWe have no hard language or tech requirements, but having experience with Linux and knowing at least one scripting language often comes in handy.liulch3Here‚Äôs what happens when you hit ‚ÄòApply‚Äôh3üíªBrief video chat, just to say hi. Hi!püëãüèΩIntroduction to Reaktor. We call this the Culture and Attitude interview. Here‚Äôs Adam to tell you more about what to expect from our interviews.püòé Technical interview. No brain teasers or sorting algos, we promise! You choose a couple of topics to discuss, we choose a couple of topics to discuss.püìÉ Closing interview. We clarify our mutual expectations of our common future. Naturally, necessities like compensation and equipment will be taken care of in a manner that satisfies us both.p‚ù§Ô∏è You‚Äôre in!p

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Remote
description: cstrongEventMobi is a remote-first company and this is a remote job.strongpEventMobi is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.pcstrongWhy EventMobi?strongpEvents and conferences are being reimagined online, and EventMobi is building on ten years of event technology experience to innovate one of the most flexible and engaging virtual event platforms. We are an award-winning tech startup with teams in Toronto, Berlin and Manila, with thousands of customers around the globe.pWe believe that live events bring people together to enable change ‚Äì both in business and our society at large. In the era of COVID-19, we have become a remote-first company and are hard at work helping thousands of events pivot to virtual. EventMobi has a huge impact on the success of our customers‚Äô events and on their attendee experience. We are on a mission to revolutionize how event planners create, market and manage their virtual and in-person events, and how remote and on-site attendees experience conferences. We would love for you to join us and leave your mark.pcstrongAbout YoustrongpIf you're looking for a software development role that allows you to drive the web and the future of virtual events forward by utilizing the latest technologies, you've come to the right place! Developers at EventMobi focus on building powerful front-ends that work across devices, are offline capable and are just as, if not more powerful, than their native counterparts. We use the best tools for the job, including React+Redux, NodeJS, Cordova, and Webpack to develop a platform that generates amp; deploys thousands of apps annually and we're constantly looking to push the bar with your help!pcstrongWhat Your Work Will Focus OnstrongpculclicstrongModern Web Applicationstrong - You will be involved in enhancing our responsive web app that powers our mobile and virtual event space products. Solving interesting problems along the way - real time content updates, offline content, UI and architecture scaling for performance.liclicstrongOwnershipstrong - From initial design to deployment, test automation to performance monitoring, you own what you build end-to-end.liclicstrongArchitecture amp; Scalestrong - Gathering insights and employing strong design principles, you will determine the best tech to address our customers needs while optimizing for scale.liclicstrongDevelopmentstrong - Best practices, craftsmanship, well thought out code and mentorship to your team is your ideal and you preach this in your own work as well as with your teammates.liclicstrongQualitystrong - You will help grow the team around you in not only pushing new capabilities for our customers, but also maintaining the utmost quality in everything we build.liulcstrongWhat You Will Bring to the Teamstrongpculcli5+ years experience as a software developer working on large or fast scaling productslicli2+ years experience working with Javascript and a deep understanding in React/Redux including - concepts such as Hooks and functional componentslicliAbility to architect elegant solutions to complex problems using appropriate abstractions and techniqueslicliComfortable working with large code baseslicliExperience working with Restful APIslicliProficient using JSX/ES6/HTML/CSSlicliExperience with Material UI or Ant DesignlicliChampion best practices and performance improvementslicliExperience with automated testing suites like Jest, Enzyme and CypresslicliAbility to debug a codebase in a self-sufficient mannerlicliExcellent written and verbal communicationlicliKnowledge of SOLID Principles, Domain Modelling, and Design Patterns is a major benefitlicliAbility to mentor and grow team members, provide technical guidance and oversight on implementation directionliulcemNice to have:empculcliExperience with Python or other server-side languageslicliExperience with Docker and AWS and CI/CD like GitHub ActionslicliExperience with WebRTC, RTMP and video codecsliulcemSome of the interesting things you will get to work on:empculcliChanging the way our app loads (cache-first to network-first strategy)licliUtilizing Redux and dynamic reducerslicliReact based page builder that generates React components with API integrationlicliAdding more engagement features (chat/group discussions/1:1 video meetings/breakout rooms)liulcstrongRemote Workspace RequirementsstrongpculcliYou have a safe, comfortable, and ergonomic workspace and working environment - a private and quiet workspace is vital for doing your best work!licliYou have a reliable ethernet connection of at least 30Mbps upload speed with wired connection or reliable WiFi at home.liulcstrongWhat will you get from EventMobi?strongpculcliWe offer the experience of a life-time working with a dynamic, open-minded and diverse team, who are excited to come to work every day and passionate about what they do and the clients they helplicliCompetitive compensationlicliCompany Stock-OptionslicliA great culture with much more along the wayliulcstrongAbout EventMobistrongpWe're focused on building the most comprehensive amp; extensible event management platform to help planners create incredible event experiences online or in-person. We believe that events bring people together to enable change. This has never been more clear in the time of COVID-19. We've already changed how 20,000+ events in 70+ countries use technology at their events. Since the launch of our Virtual Platform, hundreds of organizations have taken their events online with EventMobi. We are seeing astonishing growth opportunities for virtual events and online conferences, and are looking forward to influencing hundreds of thousands of future events.pEventMobi is a remote-first company with a distributed global workforce. We do have local offices in Toronto, Manila and Berlin but everyone is equal and communicates the same way regardless if you work from home or from the office. We are improving our working culture to be more asynchronous, with better documentation, goal setting and collaborative technologies for remote work. Being accountable for our work, along with effective planning and communication to deliver results is a critical aspect of our success as a remote-first company. We offer flexible work hours in local time zones and encourage healthy work life balance.pIf you are interested in seeing EventMobi in action, check out some of the videos below:pculclica href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tWW9jB85S3wamp;t=2s"The Experience Manager Platformaliclica href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hmJpVOe5dRE"The EventMobi Mobile Event Appaliclica href="https://thenatureofevents.com/"‚ÄúThe Nature of Events‚Äùa - a fun video showcasing the EventMobi TeamlicliTop brands and organizations from around the world have used EventMobi‚Äôs event app technology to create incredible event experiences - ca href="https://www.eventmobi.com/customers/"hear directly from our customers.aliul

If you like a dynamic work situation and working on the cutting edge in your code, this is the job for you!pWe are accepting applications for the next two months and we fill the open position as soon as we‚Äôve found the right candidate.pcstrongAbout the PositionstrongpcemFull Stack DeveloperempYou‚Äôll be joining our team in building our apps and pushing the bar by building new features.pWe typically use a Ruby(-on-Rails), React stack that we host on AWS. We like well-structured light-weight code that‚Äôs easy to understand and to work with.pWe have a clearly defined product development process and work from detailed interaction designs.pDuring the daily standups we share our progress and discuss next tasks. It‚Äôs also a great moment for sharing knowledge and challenges.pYou have a lot of autonomy with regards to deciding what the best solution is for the tasks you work on.pcstrongAbout StartupzstrongpStartupz is a startup studio that develops and launches new companies. A healthy, resilient app starts with a healthy, resilient organization.pcstrongAbout YoustrongpWe are looking for someone who is ready for this challenge with a getting things done work spirit.pcemSkillsempculcliYou have experience working with Ruby-on-RailslicliYou have a good sense of ReactlicliYou are crazy about building beautiful and intuitive interfaces and solid scalable backendlicliYou are driven and enthusiasticlicliYour communication skills in English are proficientlicliYou are comfortable to adapt and multitask in a fast-paced environmentliulcemExperienceempculcliExperience with Ruby, Python or Node.jsliulcstrongHow to ApplystrongpYou can apply via ca href="https://startupzcom.recruitee.com/o/full-stack-developer-ruby-react-stack"https://startupzcom.recruitee.com/o/full-stack-developer-ruby-react-stackapPlease send an application that speaks directly to how you would like to fill this position. title: Full Stack Developer
description: Full Stack DeveloperpLooking for exciting challenges in a high-growth, high-impact market? Ignitia has a small team of dedicated scientists, developers and meteorologists that now wish to expand with a full-time remote (GMT-1h to GMT+2h) full stack developer whose main focus will be to build and maintain front-end products amp; features as well as back-end solutions powering the products and services.pThe companyIgnitia is an entrepreneur led business that offers critical decision support in West Africa. Based on several years of development and market traction, our science-based innovation is designed for the agriculture sector. We have developed a weather forecasting model for the tropics that is twice as accurate as existing models, allowing us to provide critical weather data and forecasts to farmers and agribusinesses through various channels such as mobile phones and web dashboards. Using our forecasts, small-scale farmers have the ability to double yields and incomes, reducing food insecurity and poverty for some of the poorest in the world.pTo date we have reached over 1,500,000 farmers with our daily weather forecasts. Due to our pioneering position and proven track record we now offer the right person the opportunity to grow with the company.pThe positionIgnitia AB has a vacancy for a full-time full stack developer (estimated 50-50% balance between front-end and back-end work, varying over time) to work within the technical team while interfacing with the mobile marketing manager and other business units.pMain duties will include:p‚óè	Design, develop and maintain our front-end product portfolio and their associated back-ends including interfaces to various APIs.‚óè	Identify opportunities to improve the existing products and create efficient and robust workflows in order to enhance both internal operations as well as end-user experience.‚óè	Maintain and build various web interfaces (back-end as well as front-end)‚óè	Track and analyze end-user product/feature usage in order to identify downstream/future development opportunitiespQualificationspIn addition to having a university degree (at BSc or MSc level), we expect you to have the following experience and skills:p‚óè	3+ years of working experience in software development‚óè	In-depth understanding of the entire development process (design, development, deployment, operations and maintenance)‚óè	Engineering mindset and great problem-solving abilities‚óè	Comfortable with the Unix environment‚óè	Back-end and front-end development skills‚óè	Solid understanding of the following technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (including Vue.js), PHP (including Laravel), relational databases (including PostgreSQL), REST APIspBeneficial skills include:p‚óè	Mobile app development experience‚óè	Knowledge of GIS-related libraries/frameworks (Leaflet, PostGIS)‚óè	Strong product sense and the ability to own large areas of product design and usability (UI/UX)‚óè	Knowledge of other JavaScipt frameworks (React, Node.js) and Python (Flask, Django)‚óè	Familiar with unit testing, TDD, design patterns and modern programming practicespIn addition, you should:p‚óè	Work efficiently, valuing autonomy and getting things done, but also as part of a team‚óè	Maintain focus under rapidly changing work tasks and under time pressure‚óè	Be willing to learn and master new technologies and concepts‚óè	Have a positive attitude‚óè	Have good written and communication skills in EnglishpRemuneration amp; terms of employmentSalary commensurate with skills, expertise and experience. Other employment terms and conditions will be agreed during contracting phase.pApplicationPlease email your CV and a cover letter to info at ignitia.se with the subject ‚ÄúFull Stack Developer‚Äù. Last date for applying is February 12, 2021.pContact for questions:Daniel Salvador, Head of Systems Development, ca href="mailto:daniel.salvador@ignitia.se"daniel.salvador@ignitia.seaAndreas Vallgren, Chief Science Officer, ca href="mailto:andreas.vallgren@ignitia.se"andreas.vallgren@ignitia.seap

That is why we have dedicated cstrongSoft and Tech Team Leadsstrong to take care of your individual development plan and ensure diverse growth.licliWe believe that you should manage your own time, that is why we have a flexible working hour policy and the possibility to work from home.licliBE YOURSELF. title: Full Stack Developer
description: TubeScience is looking for a talented Full Stack Developer to join our thriving team! This role is remote flexible anywhere in the US.pQuick ‚Äòabout us‚Äô:pWe‚Äôre a data-driven video startup based in LA that‚Äôs grown to become the largest producer of video ads on paid social in the 4 years since founding. Collectively, our videos account for ~5% of all paid video views on Facebook and Instagram in North America and reach 100-200 million people per day.pWhat You‚Äôll Do:pAs an experienced Full Stack Developer, you will utilize your strong problem solving, communication skills and proficiency working cross-functionally to deliver products end-to-end. You‚Äôll also have a critical role on the TubeScience team as we produce tech solutions to support our rapid business growth. You will work with a high degree of autonomy, with high expectations on ownership and collaboration.pObjectives:pWe‚Äôre looking for a Full Stack Developer focusing on backend services that can create and tie together creative workflows, big data systems and algorithms. We‚Äôre a fast moving startup in a hyper growth phase, so we‚Äôre continuously balancing quick high impact solutions with designing for scale. If you‚Äôre looking to solve problems that no one else has, apply, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.pResponsibilities:pculcliOwn and Develop scalable solutions for internal and external userslicliCollaborate with teammates in an agile development environmentlicliChampion and follow development best practicesliulRequired Skills and Qualifications:pculcli5+ years of software development experiencelicliExperience delivering products end-to-endlicliExperience with Python/Flask or Node developmentlicliExperience working with React, Vue, or similar frameworkslicliExperience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Snowflake)licliExperience with Amazon Web ServiceslicliPassionate about applying best development practices (Unit testing, linting, etc.)licliCollaborative Team playerlicliExperience working in a structured process (Agile, Scrum etc)liulPreferred Qualifications:pculcliPast ad tech or advertising industry experience is a plusliulBenefits:pculcliExcellent Medical, Dental and Vision CoveragelicliFlexible PTOlicli401k + Matchinglicli$500/yr for Education/TraininglicliMonthly WFH StipendlicliWFH home office set uplicliPersonal CoachinglicliRemote FlexibilitylicliCreative Working EnvironmentlicliPaid Sick LeavelicliDoctor House Call On-DemandliulWhat's atypical about the company:pWe're fast and data-driven: our teams develop concepts in the morning, shoot/edit in the afternoon, launch in the evening, and iterate the next day based on real-world performance.pWe‚Äôre a behavioral Ramp;D lab at the core: We put 2,000+ video experiments per week, watched by tens of millions of people per day, that give us deep insights into how people make decisions. Over the past couple years, we‚Äôve built an enormous library of IP around human behavior and visual communication.pWe work on a pure pay for performance basis. Zero production fees for video. Clients only pay us if our videos outperform anything they‚Äôre running internally.pOur clients are among the largest advertisers on FB and Instagram, across a wide range of verticals (incl. fashion, beauty, food, fitness apps, healthcare apps, financial services), giving us unique visibility into what drives success at scale. We focus on profitable growth with clients and grow their investment by 80% on average.pApplication Process:pInterested candidates should apply directly for consideration. title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
description: WELL is a patient communication infrastructure for healthcare. We enable enterprise health systems, private practices, and vendors to conduct seamless conversations with patients across multiple channels ‚Äî including texting, email, telephone, and live chat.pWith WELL, patients receive all of their healthcare communication from one trusted source ‚Äî their provider. The platform empowers service representatives to converse with patients in real time, ensuring patients feel heard while driving staff efficiency and increased revenue.pFounded in 2015, WELL is based in Santa Barbara, California and is the highest rated patient engagement software on G2. WELL serves many of the country‚Äôs leading health systems and more than 20 million patients.pWELL is honored to be ranked number 170 on the 2020 Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies. WELL is also proud to have been named one of the 2020 Central Coast Best Places to Work by the Pacific Coast Business Times, and one of the 2020 Best Places to Work in Healthcare by Modern Healthcare. Most recently, WELL Health was recognized as one of the Best Midsize Companies to Work for in Los Angeles in 2021 by Built In LA. To learn more about WELL, please visit our LinkedIn.pSUMMARYpWELL is looking for a talented, experienced backend developer to join our fast-paced, growing engineering department. This developer will primarily be working with Node.js. As a Node.js Backend Engineer at WELL, you will work directly alongside a team of bright and motivated backend engineers, under the guidance of our Engineering Director.pYou will be responsible for working with the rest of the team to maintain and grow features in the backend code base. This work will range from supporting Node.js web facing APIs, to writing SQL queries, to developing workflows in Golang.pIn addition to being a strong developer, you will have a keen interest in how software and modern communication channels can improve the patient experience. You will also have the attention to detail and quality needed to meet high Service Level Agreements (SLAs) in a product that serves roughly 20 million patients nationwide. You will also be flexible and adaptable enough to thrive in a fluid startup environment.pRESPONSIBILITIESpBuild new backend services using Typescript on Node.js, open source technology and tools including NestJS.As an experienced engineer, you will help the team adhere to software best practices, level up others in your areas of expertise, and contribute to the architecture of our ongoing refactor project.Collaborate with the product team in an agile environment to break down requirements, plan and estimate tasks.Drive quality by writing effective unit, integration and functional tests for high availability systems and libraries.Create high availability and high throughput systems using Redis, Postgres, Kinesis, S3, MongoDB, and AWS services.Effectively collaborate with Product, QA, UX, Client Success, and other internal groups (both technical and non-technical).pREQUIREMENTSpBachelor's Degree in Computer Science5+ years designing and implementing backend services and distributed systems in a professional environmentStrong grasp of Javascript/ES fundamentals, Typescript, or strong experience in another modern OO languageProficiency in SQL (PostgreSQL) database designExperienced working with asynchronous requests in large scale applicationsCommitment to testing best practicespBONUSpCollaboration/contributions with the open source communityStrong leadership skillsExperience with:Go, PythonDockerTerraformAWSEvent sourced and microservice architecturepLOCATIONpWELL is headquartered in Santa Barbara, CA and has a satellite office in Orange County, CA. Today, all WELL positions are remote, and we are looking forward to when our company returns to in-office work. We are open to candidates that are looking for a permanently remote role depending on their level of experience. Historically, remote team members visit the Santa Barbara office regularly, and we‚Äôve found that works best when they are on the West Coast, specifically in Southern California.pPERKS AND BENEFITSpFantastic company culture ‚Äì frequent Zoom company events (Lunch amp; Learns, trivia, yoga, etc.) and daily fun brought to you by many creative Slack channels.pWorkplace groups ‚Äì company committees available for all to join (Diversity amp; Inclusion and Workplace Engagement).pLearning and development ‚Äì frequent events and tools available to help our employees #PursueGrowth.pCareer mobility ‚Äì we promote from within and have opportunities for employees to transfer between teams.pSanta Barbara office perks: dog-friendly office, healthy (and unhealthy) snacks, Kombucha on tap, light-filled space, Sonos workplace, ergonomic desk setup, and the occasional taco truck.pMacBook Pros providedpUnlimited PTOpGenerous equity packagepFull health benefits ‚Äì medical/dental/visionpWELL Health Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to fair and equitable hiring practices. All hiring decisions at WELL are based on strategic business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. All candidates are considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other protected status.pWELL is dedicated to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace, where everyone feels safe to be themselves and express their thoughts and opinions. WELL is committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment; WELL will not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind.p

title: Frontend Engineer
description: cstrongOur StorystrongTrust is a fundamental part of humanity, but with the rise of the internet over the last couple of decades, we‚Äôve seen a plethora of trust issues emerge like spam, fraudulent transactions, hate speech, and online abuse. Today, with AI, computers take on more tasks usually done by humans, with an increase in efficiency and productivity. However, We understand the implications of AI, and the potential danger of not having visibility into how it affects the real world. There is a lack of trust in AI outcomes because often AI models can be opaque.   We started Fiddler because we believe there is a need for a new kind of Explainable AI Platform. One that enables organizations to get ahead of these issues by building trustworthy, transparent, and understandable AI solutions.pcstrongWho We ArestrongOur team is motivated by helping the world to unlock the AI BlackBox. We know that AI is the future and believe that learning the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the results is crucial to any business or platform.pWe are still an early-stage startup, and are rapidly growing our team! This is an exciting time to join an XAI startup that is quickly becoming a leader in the space.pFiddler Labs is recognized as a pioneer in the field of Explainable AI and has received numerous accolades, including 100 most promising Technology Pioneers of 2020 by the World Economic Forum, Forbes 50 most promising AI startups, and a Cool Vendor in Gartner‚Äôs 2019 Cool Vendors in Enterprise AI Governance and Ethical Response report.We are looking for a design-oriented and collaborative Frontend Engineer to help us continue to build this platform.pcstrongWhat You'll DostrongDesign, build, support, and own the front-end components of our enterprise software product, including UIs and visualization for AI explainability and monitoringWork with data science teams to understand their requirements, and our design / product team do design clear, simple data visualizations and intuitive interfacesWork with the technical and product team to iterate on different user interfaces, and continuously look for ways to improve the customer usability experienceCreate reusable and maintainable frontend systemspcstrongWhat We're Looking ForstrongBS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent industry experienceDeep experience with React, Javascript, and Redux. title: Frontend Developer
description: The opportunity:pJoin us and be a part of a start-up cell of a large international company, where you will be working with state-of-the-art technology, make use of NLP and Machine Learning, and where your career can grow exponentially.pYou will be part of the Paperpal team powered by CACTUS, where we are rethinking how science is communicated and helping scientists write better science smarter. You will be part of an international working environment, with employees across the EU and Asia, who work together to build cutting-edge web experiences and APIs used globally by scientists.pThis is a remote working opportunity.pResponsibilities:‚Ä¢Write new functionality in an existing frontend framework, a modern tech stack with React, Node.js, Redux and Typescript, with focus on the Typescript part of the stack‚Ä¢Working with tools, technologies and plugin architectures that will challenge your abilities to write and work in asynchronous editing scenarios to achieve best-in-class results for users‚Ä¢Work with advanced Typescript features like generators, iterators, currying, types (intersection, union, etc.), pipeline operators, symbols and others where necessary and meaningful‚Ä¢Build and release software through Jenkins, onto an AWS microservice architecture using Docker‚Ä¢Being part of a small team of about 3-4 people, participating in stand ups, and delivering code into this team‚Ä¢Being part of code reviews of your and other people's codepRequirements (Desires skills amp; experience)‚Ä¢You have at minimum 4 years (including side projects, student jobs, etc. Does not include code written as part of a university degree) experience programming in Typescript‚Ä¢Some knowledge of UI frameworks like React or Angular is nice to have, but not required‚Ä¢Some knowledge of state management libraries like Redux, MobX or NgRx is nice to have, but not required‚Ä¢Some knowledge of integration with the online word processors in Office 365 or Google Docs is nice to have, but not required‚Ä¢You have knowledge of best practices in frontend development around Typescript, types, asynchronicity and text editing‚Ä¢You are motivated, curious and independent, with a desire to learn, and be a part of a growing company.‚Ä¢You are motivated to learn from people with deep industry insights ‚Äì but also willing to challenge and question decisions, and ask intelligent questions.pAbout us:pCactus Communications is a technology company accelerating scientific advancement. We collaborate with researchers, universities, publishers, academic societies, and life science organizations. We offer editorial, translation, education, and training solutions for researchers; strategic and tactical scientific content solutions to global life science organizations; AI-powered scholarly publishing solutions for journals and researchers; and solutions for science dissemination and engagement with peers, public, and policymakers for wider research outreach. We also incubate seed and early-stage startups that share our mission to solve global problems with science and technology solutions.pWe have offices in London, Princeton, Singapore, Beijing, Shanghai, Tokyo, Seoul, Aarhus, and Mumbai; a global workforce of over 3,000 experts; and customers from over 190 countries.p

title: (Senior) Backend Engineer
description: Millionen von Menschen weltweit arbeiten in administrativen Jobs und verrichten Tag f√ºr Tag stark repetitive Arbeiten. Wir glauben, dass das Kopieren und Einf√ºgen von Daten aus Dokumenten in andere IT-Systeme nicht die heutige Antwort auf die Zukunft der Arbeit sein kann. Wir wollen das √§ndern und einen Arbeitsplatz mit weniger Monotonie und daf√ºr mehr Wirkung, Kreativit√§t und Zweck schaffen!pUnsere Vision bei Workist ist es, k√ºnstliche Intelligenz einzusetzen, um repetitive Aufgaben zu automatisieren und den Menschen die Freiheit zu geben, das zu tun, was sie lieben.pWir wurden 2019 in Berlin gegr√ºndet und werden von erfahrenen Serial Entrepreneurs und VCs unterst√ºtzt. Wir haben ein starkes Team mit diversen Hintergr√ºnden und Erfahrung von McKinsey, SAP, IBM, Minodes, Voi, MIT, KIT, Uni Mannheim und LMU amp; TUM. Mit unserer k√ºrzlich aufgenommenen Seed-Finanzierung wollen wir unsere Aktivit√§ten ausweiten und suchen nach leidenschaftlichen und talentierten Mitarbeitern, um das Produkt und das Unternehmen auf die n√§chste Stufe zu bringen.pcstrongDeine AufgabenstrongpculcliDecide on technical architecture and infrastructurelicliDevelop software along our Definition of donelicliDevelop software in the entire tech stacklicliProvide feedback to team members on where and how to improvelicliHelp out and mentor other team members to ensure overall development quality amp; velocitylicliTake ‚ÄúContinuous improvement‚Äù seriously by identifying opportunities for streamlining work and reducing wastelicliBe accountable for service levelslicliWrite documentation where necessarylicliTake care of IT Security and Data PrivacyliulcstrongDein ProfilstrongpWe‚Äôre looking for people that are passionate about what they do and ready to take over responsibilities. We‚Äôre creating a work environment where people should follow their curiosity and have a strong urge to put the business forward to help fulfill our mission.pSince you will work very closely with our founding team on our AI Technology we believe it is important that you feel comfortable with at least some of the points below.pculcliFluent in Python or if you consider yourself polyglotlicliExperience with Django, Flask or similarlicliExperience in setting up cloud infrastructure with terraformlicliKubernetes ExperiencelicliCI/CD ExperienceliulIt would be even greater if you find your self in the next list:pculcliDue to our customer base, German is a pluslicliSome first experience with Machine LearninglicliExperience working with GraphqllicliExperience with Typescript, React JS and ApolloliulcstrongWarum wir?strongpDo you want to really take over responsibilities and do not face micromanagement from an incompetent boss? Then you‚Äôre at Workist in the right place. We commit as founders and as a company to build an organization that promotes domain ownership and gives people the freedom to decide within their domain independently. This does not mean that you‚Äôre on your own.pOn the contrary, we believe in teamwork and helping each other out. We want to achieve great things together and believe in working in small iterations towards a big goal. Therefore we follow agile best practices in business and tech teams and set sprint, quarterly, and yearly goals to work efficiently towards them. Everyone is welcome to contribute to our company goals and also raise red flags when something is not going as planned.pculcliActively shape an early-stage SaaS startuplicliTake on ownership from day onelicliFlat hierarchy with an open and transparent communication culturelicliFlexible work from home policy and an office in the heart of BerlinlicliRegular (virtual) team eventslicliCompetitive salary, extensive individual feedback sessions, and great opportunities for career progressionliulcstrongUnser Tech StackstrongpWe believe in operational excellence along with our development and research tasks. Therefore we have code reviews and a fully automated CI/CD pipeline to help to bring ideas from theory to production as smooth and fast as possible. You build code, ship, and maintain your applications in our stack:pculcliAI-Stack: Detectron2, Pytorch, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn, CUDA (Tesla V100s),licliFront-End: React JS, Graphql (Apollo)licliBackend-End: Grahpql, Python, Django, FlasklicliDatabase: Postgres, Elastic Search, Blob StoragelicliDev Ops/Infrastructure: Gitlab, Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, MS Azure, AWSliulcimg src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/0c214862134e119495370739daaa7edd791b47a9/68747470733a2f2f742e676f686972696e672e636f6d2f682f35623964653661666138623135353136396231333065386635316538343037343366613231626234643539326536383730393966353363373532326464353436"p

title: Software Architect
description: We will set you up with all the necessary tools to perform the job from your home office.pEarnest empowers people with the financial capital to live better livespWe're an accomplished team of design, math, finance and technology geeks who believe consumer lending can be radically improved and are doing something about it. We created a company that combines data science, streamlined design, and technology to:pBuild products that simplify the lending process,Provide them to more people, andEngage with our customers through more human experiences.pAs a Software Architect at Earnest, you will report to the Senior Manager of Platform Engineering, provide technical direction, and build the software that is revolutionizing consumer lending, automating the loan approval process and orchestrating the transfer of billions of dollars. In addition to the $10+ billion in loans serviced, we build tools to maximize Earnest's growth while providing the best possible client experience. Our focus is on building a modern platform that allows us to move faster over time. This means a willingness to rethink domains from first principles and an ability to collaborate well across technical and non-technical teams.pAt Earnest, we use Node.js and TypeScript on the server-side. On the front-end we use React/Redux for building new things and Angular for everything else. We deploy services in Docker and Kubernetes on AWS. We integrate with other internal microservices (written in Node.js and Scala) and store the bulk of our data in Postgres and Amazon S3.pWhat you'll do:pculcliDrive systems architecture redesign while working with other stakeholders.licliArchitect and implement domain-based microservices, such as user service, loan service, etc.licliPrototype solutions for the broader engineering teams, such as a message bus for asynchronous communication between backend services.licliCreate engineering requirement documents and assist with planning of new features and bug fixes.licliMentor and provide guidance on engineering best practices to team members.licliLaunch new features such as an integration with strategic partners, such as Optimizely and Plaid.licliWork with Product, Design, and Engineering Management on priorities with the team.liulIdeal background and expertise:pculcli10+ years of professional development experiencelicli2+ years of experience architecting distributed software systemslicliExperience with server-side concepts, e.g. microservices, database, caching, performance, - monitoring, scalabilitylicliExperience with Node.js preferredlicliExperience working in Fintech, Banking, or related Consumer Financial Services companies is a plusliulEarnest Perks amp; Benefits:pculcliHealth, Dental, amp; Vision benefits plus savings planslicliEmployee Stock Purchase Planlicli401(k) plan to help you save for retirement plus a company matchlicliTuition reimbursement programlicli$1000 Travel perk on each Earnie-versary to anywhere in the world and 25 days of annual PTOlicliGreat culture with an awesome teamliulEarnest provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, genetics, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for the position in a manner consistent with the Fair Chance Ordinance.p

title: Back End Developer
description: ch2Company Overview:h2Excelerate America (EA) is a network for small business entrepreneurs to transform their businesses from small to mighty. Collaborating with a diverse set of partners and communities, EA brings together a community wanting to help each other thrive; through inspiration, problem-solving, and access to curated products and services. The next phase of EA‚Äôs growth is to develop a dynamic and engaging mobile community platform driven by peer-to-peer problem-solving. This platform will help EA scale and connect its existing communities to power-up entrepreneurs' abilities to work together, get guidance from peers, and have a greater impact in their local communities.pch2Job Overview:h2The Backend engineer works as a leading member of EA‚Äôs growing software and product technology team to help architect, develop, and launch EA‚Äôs platform.pAs a critical member of the product team, the Backend Engineer will work closely with the founding leadership and product development team to architect EA‚Äôs data structure, learning algorithms, and front-end integrations to build a platform that delivers a personalized and cutting edge experience to our users and partners. You will be one of the founding software engineers working closely with our Engineering Lead to design our new platform, help to scale it, and establish the way we work as a software-oriented organization. Remote will be considered.pch2Responsibilities and Duties:h2culcliWork with EA Dev team to develop EA APIs and EA Server-side Apps and documentationlicliDocument and test all EA APIs and EA Server-Side Apps and help build a culture of testing throughout our build processlicliSetup, configure and monitor the various EA servers, hosting, and databases including dev, staging, production for both EA marketing sites and EA platformlicliSetup, maintain, test, and create authentication, payment, and other gatewayslicliSetup repos in Git and workflows for continuous integrationlicliTroubleshoot server issues and performance bottleneckslicliCapable of scaling applications to handle the load changes.licliDesign, implement, maintain and automate the appropriate backup and recovery architecture as requiredliulch2Qualifications:h2culcliBachelors of Computer Science or equivalent learning/experiencelicli5+ years of experience in engineering including experience building, launching and scaling a consumer or enterprise product or platformlicliDeep understanding of NodeJs programming language and framework, including the development and optimization of server-less functionslicliDeep understanding of databases NoSQL, MySQL as well as experience with and/or familiarity with GraphQLlicliProven experience working with multiple disciplines including business, front-end, and design and enjoy a highly collaborative environmentlicliExperience with agile development and/or sprint-based developmentlicliAbility to set up development and production environments or the engineering teams including virtualization and container technology, GIT, and continuous integration workflows..licliKnowledge of security, privacy, and compliance as it applies to online users and payment gatewayslicliBasic knowledge of front-end technologies, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, so that you can work closely with EA‚Äôs front-end development and design teamlicliBasic Knowledge of Machine Learningliul

title: Software developer Web Application (m/f/d)
description: Unicon Software is a pioneer and technology leader in software solutions for thin clients. Since our foundation in 1993, we have been able to continuously expand our technical know-how and product portfolio.pWith the Linux-based eLux¬Æ operating system and the associated management software Scout Enterprise Management Suite¬Æ, we offer the most powerful software solution for a central IT architecture. More than 1.5 million end devices in over 65 countries worldwide are currently operated and managed with our software. Our largest customer alone uses eLux¬Æ on more than 220,000 end devices and thus operates the world's largest centrally managed, heterogeneous thin client installation.pWe have a wide range of customers from various industries that rely on Unicon's technology, such as DATEV, Deutsche Bahn, Sparkassen Finanz Informatik, AOK or Viessmann - all of them benefit from a highly scalable and hardware-agnostic integrated solution portfolio. In addition, we cooperate with several major distribution partners and are OEM partners of Fujitsu, HP and other well-known manufacturers.pCurrently, we are strongly growing and want to expand our team significantly for the optimization of existing as well as the development of new applications. You want to design the web version of our management solution? Then you are exactly right with us.pcstrongTasksstrongpBeing part of the team building our Scout Enterprise Web ApplicationDeveloping the backend with Node.js and MongoDB Working on frontend development with React and ReduxOptimizing the application for high performance, reliability and clusteringRealizing sophisticated applications and services in an agile development environmentWorking on requirements engineering and well as the architecture and design of the corresponding componentsBeing the contact person for technical issues and in charge of the decision-making regarding specific componentspcstrongRequirementsstrongpculcliUniversity degree in computer science, electrical engineering, physics, mathematics or completed training as an IT specialistlicliSeveral years of experience as full stack developer with JavascriptlicliExperience with MongoDB or MS SQL ServerlicliStrong knowledge of Linux and gitlicliAnalytical mind and a great understanding of complex algorithmslicliCuriosity about how things work and eagerness to improve themlicliGood English skills (spoken and written) and good German skillsliulcstrongWhy Unicon?strongpculcliYou‚Äôll have the chance to design an innovative application according to your ideas and thus further develop our solutions, which are used on more than 1.5 million deviceslicliWe see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individuallicliYou will be part of an agile tech company on the path of growthlicliWe are the technological leader in an innovative IT sectorlicliIn the 25+ years of our existence, we have reached an extremely high level of professionalism and technical expertiselicliAt the same time, the atmosphere is still start-up-like and very dynamic, with flat hierarchies and flexible working modelslicliWe encourage the contribution and implementation of own ideas in the sense of extensive personal responsibilitylicliOur teams are characterized by an open communication culture and a strong motivation to performlicliWe offer you an attractive and performance-oriented compensation packageliul

title: Full stack engineer
description: cstrongFull stack engineerstrongpThere are a lot of things we think are great about working at Linktree but we are biased, so here are the answers to the things we get asked most by Engineers when we are hiring at Linktree:pcstrongWhat is your tech stack?strongThe below doesn't mean we expect everyone to have all of the below, our primary languages are react, node.js with some legacy PHP so that is great to have as a starting point.pThe rest of our stack includes React, Node.js, Typescript, Storybook, Elasticsearch, REST APIs, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, AWS (Lambda), Kubernetes, Terraform and Snowflake. Our first build was in PHP so that is in our legacy code but React/Node is where the stack is headed.pcstrongWhat do you look for in engineers?strongGreat problem solvers who enjoy collaborating with others (not just engineers) that value well written and tested code. A match with our current tech stack and the ongoing desire to continue to learn new skills and share yours with others. Experience in similar startup environments can be good as you are used to this style of working but we care more about you and your skills over what names are on your CV.pcstrongWhere is this role based?strongWe are mostly based in Melbourne but currently have engineers in Perth, Tasmania, Newcastle, Queensland, country Victoria, and Ireland. Our CTO ca href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/mitchmalone/"cstrongMitch Malonestronga is also fully remote so you could be anywhere really. We are still all working from home due to COVID but plan on being a mixed remote and on-site company beyond that.pcstrongWhat is your dev environment like?strongLinktree has grown a lot and quite quickly, which means our structures and processes aren't perfect, yet. That should be ok with you and if anything, appeal to you so you can contribute to the design of those systems.We are agile with one of our Lead Engineers also an agile coach and cross-functional. We don't have BA's or have any intention of hiring in the near future, as we expect our Engineers to do requirements analysis and work closely with Product Managers and Designers on developing user stories. Our Engineering team writes unit, integration and e2e tests and we have a DevOps specialist building out DevOps practices.pcstrongWhat is your company culture like?strongLinktree's company culture and values are based around collaboration, diversity, inclusion, and flexibility. Those are all nice words but to give you some more specific examples:pculcliWe are family-friendly and flexible work environment with our team with a number of our team working hours around school and home commitments.licliWe have several diversity and inclusion initiatives underway, including a Damp;I council, training for all staff on neurodiversity and the incorporation of a transgender inclusion policy.licliOur team is diverse across age, gender, and race and we love that.licliDue to COVID we are all remote but even when COVID is behind us, we will be a mixed remote and in-office company. With our team already spread across 8 locations and 3 countries, we will always be some form of remote. licliAll employees have free access to ca href="https://www.smilingmind.com.au/"cstronghttps://www.smilingmind.com.au/stronga amp; ca href="https://uprise.co/"cstronghttps://uprise.co/stronga, including 1:1 coaching sessions from qualified psychologists or counselors.liulWe have grown quickly in 2020, from 20 people to 40 in the past 6 months, and have more growth planned due to the continued expansion of our customer base around the world.pcstrongThe Linktree story‚Ä¶strongpThe Linktree journey begins in 2016, when co-founders Alex, Anthony and Nick were running a digital agency and using Instagram to make announcements about the artists they managed. Created as a side hustle to solve a simple problem, Linktree has well outgrown its roots, with over 9 million users worldwide, 20,000 + new signups every day, and over 120 million unique views per month. Paired with rapid growth, Linktree has recently garnered much attention in the tech world, earning 4th place on Fast Company's ca href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90457904/social-media-most-innovative-companies-2020"cstrong"10 most innovative social media companies of 2020"stronga.pThe Linktree audience is broad, spanning publications, artists, celebrities, fashion and beauty influencers, YouTube stars, sports teams and household brands, right the way through to individuals with a side hustle and micro-influencers. Linktree subscribers include Alicia Keys, Selena Gomez, Pharrell, Jamie Oliver, Vice, Red Bull, Adult Swim, Patreon, Naomi Campbell, Comedy Central, Gordon Ramsay, Billabong‚Ä¶and many more!pIf you're still reading this and feel like you're a match for us, please send your details through via the ca href="https://ltpx.nl/yRdpuM7"cstrongapplication formstronga.pcemAgency calls are not appreciated.emcimg src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/9c17178fc40d5bebab71a2963dbea175de93a924/68747470733a2f2f742e6c7470782e6e6c2f747261636b2e7068703f6f7264657269643d323231353930"p
